definition: (coll.) unable to withstand/cannot bear/can't stand it/no match for
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc
(negative prefix)/not/no
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: I wear glasses and I've found that I have tension in my ears to hold my glasses in place.
sentences.chinese: 我耳朵處肌肉就繃緊了，否則它們架不住我的眼鏡。

sentences.english: The little one could stand it no longer. His nose twitching, he burst out crying.
sentences.chinese: 小毛頭招架不住了，鼻子一抽，哇地一聲哭起來。

sentences.english: He rambled on at great length but I couldn't make head or tail of what he said.
sentences.chinese: 主隊雖然技術不錯，也架不住客隊合作得好。

sentences.english: The work has overwhelmed them a bit.
sentences.chinese: 這份工作讓他們有點招架不住了。

sentences.english: The exertion that that wench acts in pettish is severe, I also ordinarily can not sustain the blows.
sentences.chinese: 那丫頭撒嬌的功夫是厲害，朕也經常招架不住的。

sentences.english: Too many students losing some of the reforms will.
sentences.chinese: 過多的改革會讓學生招架不住。

sentences.english: True, these are give away chips the other side doesn't expect to win, but that's not the point.
sentences.chinese: 的確，你會虛晃用的籌碼，讓對方招架不住，但這。

can't persuade/unable to make (sb) change their mind/unable to resist (sb)

to no avail/of no use
unavoidable/can't be avoided
just/simply/stubbornly/really
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to be of use
eventually/after all/anyhow
not necessarily/not likely
to coax and pester (idiom)/to wheedle/to cajole
